  • Constructor Details

    • WeatherServiceImpl

  • Method Details

    • oneCallAPI

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject oneCallAPI(Coord coord, Vector<String> exclude) throws IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      This method call the OneCallAPI from OpenWeather, it always returns a response unless there are errors in OpenWeather servers.

      There are few Exceptions generated, if a class get one of them it has to rethrow it because we use it to generate an error to the user

      Here is the link to OpenWeather OneCall documentation

      Specified by:
      oneCallAPI in interface WeatherService
      Parameters:
      coord - this parameter is the coordinates parameter. Lat and lon are needed to compute the API
      exclude - this vector contains the strings of which parts of the API have to be ignored, key words are: Current ( for current weather), Minutely (return prob. of precipitations every minute for 1 hour, it's always ignored in our calls ), Hourly ( weather hour by hour), Daily ( weather day by day ), Alerts ( national weather alerts, in our routes it isn't used )
      Returns:
      JSONObject the API return a JSONObject which contains all weather informations required for the routes
      Throws:
      IOException - exception generated by a wrong Input/Outout
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - exception generated if it isn't possible to parse the returned object into a Json

    • geocodingAPI

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject geocodingAPI(String name) throws CityNotFoundException, IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      This method call the Geocoding API from OpenWeather, it returns the JSON of the city, or an Expcetion in case the city not exists. That API is mostly used to get lat and lon required for OneCallAPI

      There are few Exceptions generated, if a class get one of them it has to rethrow it because we use it to generate an error to the user

      Here is the link to OpenWeather Geocoding documentation

      Specified by:
      geocodingAPI in interface WeatherService
      Parameters:
      name - the only input parameter is a name of city
      Returns:
      JSONObject the API return a JSONObject which contains informations about the city ( name in different languages, latitude, longitude , country)
      Throws:
      CityNotFoundException - if the class that call this method get this exception, it has to rethrow its. ( personalized exception )
      IOException - exception generated by a wrong Input/Outout
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - exception generated if it isn't possible to parse the returned object into a Json

    • historicalWeatherAPI

      public org.json.simple.JSONObject historicalWeatherAPI(Coord coord, Date start) throws IOException, org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
      This method call the Historical API from OpenWeather, it returns the JSON of weather hour by hour. That API always returns something unless server errors occurred or in case the StartDate parameter go out of acceptable past days range.

      There are few Exceptions generated, if a class get one of them it has to rethrow it because we use it to generate an error to the user

      Here is the link to OpenWeather HistoricalAPI documentation

      Specified by:
      historicalWeatherAPI in interface WeatherService
      Parameters:
      coord - this parameter is the coordinates parameter, lat and lon are needed to compute the API
      start - that represents the datetime where the API starts to return weather informations hour by hour and it does up to the midnight of variable's day
      Returns:
      JSONObject the return object contains informations on the weather hour by hour
      Throws:
      IOException - exception generated by a wrong Input/Outout
      org.json.simple.parser.ParseException - exception generated if it isn't possible to parse the returned object into a Json
